snippet: State officials on Friday instituted stricter rules for oil and gas industry disposal wells like one that scientists have linked to minor earthquakes in Youngstown.
abstract: Ohio officials institute stricter rules for oil and gas industry disposal wells like one that scientists have linked to minor earthquakes in Youngstown; rules are contained in report by Ohio Department of Natural Resources that found a 'compelling argument' that the quakes in Youngstown were induced by the disposal of waste liquids from the drilling process called hydraulic fracturing.
lead_paragraph: State officials on Friday instituted stricter rules for oil and gas industry disposal wells like one that scientists have linked to minor earthquakes in Youngstown.
